subject: InStorage: fix problem when doing instance live migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-20 09:21:27.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/inspur/instorage/instorage_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/inspur/instorage/test_iscsi_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/35a537d2b332cc240fdef1cd5009d3bc45668baa', 'message': 'InStorage: fix problem when doing instance live migration

When doing instance live migration, the volume will be mapped to two hosts
at the same time, so that the driver should always allow multihost map
during initialize connection.

Change-Id: I5a8892a49e56f6698d5a4d60b6422c49a0318ef1
Closes-bug: #1738965
'}]
commit_message:
InStorage: fix problem when doing instance live migration

When doing instance live migration, the volume will be mapped to two hosts
at the same time, so that the driver should always allow multihost map
during initialize connection.

Change-Id: I5a8892a49e56f6698d5a4d60b6422c49a0318ef1
Closes-bug: #1738965
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/74/529274/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_instorage_initialize_iscsi_connection_multihost(self): connector_a = {'host': 'instorage-mcs-host-a', 'wwnns': ['20000090fa17311e', '20000090fa17311f'], 'wwpns': ['ff00000000000000', 'ff00000000000001'], 'initiator': 'iqn.1993-08.org.debian:01:eac5ccc1aaa'} # host-volume map return value exp_path_a = {'driver_volume_type': 'iscsi', 'data': {'target_discovered': False, 'target_iqn': 'iqn.1982-01.com.inspur:1234.sim.node1', 'target_portal': '1.234.56.78:3260', 'target_lun': 0, 'auth_method': 'CHAP', 'discovery_auth_method': 'CHAP'}} connector_b = {'host': 'instorage-mcs-host-b', 'wwnns': ['30000090fa17311e', '30000090fa17311f'], 'wwpns': ['ff00000000000002', 'ff00000000000003'], 'initiator': 'iqn.1993-08.org.debian:01:eac5ccc1aab'} # host-volume map return value exp_path_b = {'driver_volume_type': 'iscsi', 'data': {'target_discovered': False, 'target_iqn': 'iqn.1982-01.com.inspur:1234.sim.node1', 'target_portal': '1.234.56.78:3260', 'target_lun': 1, 'auth_method': 'CHAP', 'discovery_auth_method': 'CHAP'}} volume_iSCSI = self._create_volume() extra_spec = {'capabilities:storage_protocol': '<in> iSCSI'} vol_type_iSCSI = volume_types.create(self.ctxt, 'iSCSI', extra_spec) volume_iSCSI['volume_type_id'] = vol_type_iSCSI['id'] # Make sure that the volumes have been created self._assert_vol_exists(volume_iSCSI['name'], True) # check that the hosts not exist ret = self.iscsi_driver._assistant.get_host_from_connector( connector_a) self.assertIsNone(ret) ret = self.iscsi_driver._assistant.get_host_from_connector( connector_b) self.assertIsNone(ret) # Initialize connection to map volume to host a ret = self.iscsi_driver.initialize_connection( volume_iSCSI, connector_a) self.assertEqual(exp_path_a['driver_volume_type'], ret['driver_volume_type']) # check host-volume map return value for k, v in exp_path_a['data'].items(): self.assertEqual(v, ret['data'][k]) ret = self.iscsi_driver._assistant.get_host_from_connector( connector_a) self.assertIsNotNone(ret) # Initialize connection to map volume to host b ret = self.iscsi_driver.initialize_connection( volume_iSCSI, connector_b) self.assertEqual(exp_path_b['driver_volume_type'], ret['driver_volume_type']) # check the return value for k, v in exp_path_b['data'].items(): self.assertEqual(v, ret['data'][k]) ret = self.iscsi_driver._assistant.get_host_from_connector( connector_b) self.assertIsNotNone(ret)

commit_message:
Add some clarifications to AIO dev guide

Add some clarifications to the AIO dev guide, based on real-world
points of confusion that have arisen:
- Do I *have* to use Ubuntu 16.04?
- What docker should I use?
- Should I run the scripts as root?

Change-Id: I8affdde16b63cc078aa496bf168154c93c39b3bf

subject: Add network congestion detection to monasca
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-19 13:57:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent/commit/8c4acdb8e30d48e0de01256c13cdc74fe9f60faf', 'message': 'Add network congestion detection to monasca

To allow monasca detecting network congestion, we add a new agent plugin
for monasca-agent module based on Explicit Congestion Notification (ECN) tos bits.
The agent will create a map between the number of Congestion Encountered(CE) packets/bytes
and the source ip address responsible of the congestion. The source could be a compute or
(if activated) a set of VMs deployed in a compute. After each check, the agent sends the
value of packets/bytes and timestamp to monasca API for any further processing and keeps
the metric counters into a cache file. This piece of information could be used to trigger
a new kind of performance alarm based on congestion calculation in monasca threshold.

Change-Id: I98405524588582065c7825ca511c489d59826cda
Task: 5750
Story: 2001234
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-20 16:29:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent/commit/8d620aa3f42073d8dc67bd7213e0447a340e9f5b', 'message': 'Add network congestion detection to monasca

To allow monasca detecting network congestion, we add a new agent plugin
for monasca-agent module based on Explicit Congestion Notification (ECN) tos bits.
The agent will create a map between the number of Congestion Encountered(CE) packets/bytes
and the source ip address responsible of the congestion. The source could be a compute or
(if activated) a set of VMs deployed in a compute. First, we ensure that ECN marking is
enabled for both edges. Second, we check ecn_packets and enc_bytes associated to each
source of congestion. Last, the agent sends these values and their timestamp to monasca API
for any further processing and keeps the metric counters into a cache file. This piece of
information could be used to trigger a new kind of performance alarm based on congestion
calculation in monasca threshold.

enabled for both edges. Second, we check ecn.packets and ecn.bytes and calculate ecn.cong.rate
associated to each source of congestion. Last, the agent sends the three metrics and their timestamp
to monasca API for any further processing and keeps the metric counters into a cache file.
This piece of information could be used to trigger a new kind of performance alarm in monasca
threshold.

Change-Id: I98405524588582065c7825ca511c489d59826cda

Story: 2001234

commit_message:
Add network congestion detection to monasca

To allow monasca detecting network congestion, we add a new agent plugin for monasca-agent
module based on Explicit Congestion Notification (ECN) tos bits. The agent will create a
map between the number of Congestion Encountered(CE) packets/bytes and the source ip address
responsible of the congestion. The source could be a compute or (if activated) a set of VMs
deployed in a compute. First, we ensure that ECN marking is enabled for both edges. Second,
we check ecn.packets and ecn.bytes and calculate ecn.cong.rate associated to each source of
congestion. Last, the agent sends the three metrics and their timestamp to monasca API for
any further processing and keeps the metric counters into a cache file. This piece of
information could be used to trigger a new kind of performance alarm in monasca threshold.

Change-Id: I98405524588582065c7825ca511c489d59826cda
Task: 5750
Story: 2001234

added_lines: # (c) Copyright 2015-2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development LP # Copyright 2017 SUSE Linux GmbH # Copyright 2017 OrangeLabs import monasca_setup.agent_config import monasca_setup.detection import logging import ConfigParser from monasca_agent.common.psutil_wrapper import psutil import os log = logging.getLogger(__name__) # Directory to use for metric caches cache_dir = "/dev/shm" #Time in second of each chek by the collector collect_period = 1 #Enable vm congestion check enable_vm = True # Acceptable arguments acceptable_args = ['username', 'password', 'project_name', 'auth_url', 'cache_dir','collect_period', 'region_name'] class Congestion(monasca_setup.detection.Plugin): """Configures congestion detection plugin.""" def _detect(self): """Run detection, set self.available True if the service is detected.""" self.available = True # Start with plugin-specific configuration parameters # Try to detect the location of the Nova configuration file. # Walk through the list of processes, searching for 'nova-compute' # process with 'nova.conf' inside one of the parameters nova_conf = None for proc in psutil.process_iter(): try: cmd = proc.as_dict(['cmdline'])['cmdline'] if len(cmd) > 2 and 'python' in cmd[0] and 'nova-compute' in cmd[1]: conf_indexes = [cmd.index(y) for y in cmd if 'nova.conf' in y] if not conf_indexes: continue param = conf_indexes[0] if '=' in cmd[param]: nova_conf = cmd[param].split('=')[1] else: nova_conf = cmd[param] except (IOError, psutil.NoSuchProcess): # Process has already terminated, ignore continue if (nova_conf is not None and os.path.isfile(nova_conf)): self.available = True self.nova_conf = nova_conf def build_config(self): """Build the config as a Plugins object and return. """ config = monasca_setup.agent_config.Plugins() log.info("Configuring congestion plugin") nova_cfg = ConfigParser.SafeConfigParser() log.info("\tUsing nova configuration file {0}".format(self.nova_conf)) nova_cfg.read(self.nova_conf) # Which configuration options are needed for the plugin YAML? # Use a dict so that they can be renamed later if necessary cfg_needed = {'username': 'username', 'password': 'password', 'project_name': 'project_name'} cfg_section = 'keystone_authtoken' region_name_sec= 'neutron' init_config = {'cache_dir': cache_dir, 'collect_period': collect_period, 'enable_vm': enable_vm } for option in cfg_needed: init_config[option] = nova_cfg.get(cfg_section, cfg_needed[option]) init_config['region_name'] = nova_cfg.get(region_name_sec,'region_name') # Create an identity URI (again, slightly different for Devstack) if nova_cfg.has_option(cfg_section, 'auth_url'): init_config['auth_url'] = nova_cfg.get(cfg_section, 'auth_url') else: init_config['auth_url'] = nova_cfg.get(cfg_section, 'identity_uri') config = monasca_setup.agent_config.Plugins() config['congestion'] = {'init_config': init_config, 'instances': []} return config def dependencies_installed(self): return True

commit_message:
Replace colon with a dash.

IPv6 addresses have colons
as separators, in this case
we cant name an order with colons.

To preserve the IPv6 address we
can replace it with a dash.

Change-Id: I87a1fb8952081dcb49f64ffff62414df120dccac
Closes-bug: 1740261

commit_message:
Added more rootwrap filters for dragonflow debug

Added ability to call ovs-appctl, this is to allow calling the
SimulateAndSend for a packet for debug purposes.

commit_message:
Gnocchi: many chart fixes

This PS fixes ceph pool creation and secret management, RBAC and
Image naming conventions for the Gnocchi chart.

Change-Id: I8ad569f9420e3575d6c26c5933f23048096161f5

deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash # Client constraint file contains this client version pin that is in conflict # with installing the client from source. We should remove the version pin in # the constraints file before applying it for from-source installation. CONSTRAINTS_FILE="$1" shift 1 set -e # NOTE(tonyb): Place this in the tox enviroment's log dir so it will get # published to logs.openstack.org for easy debugging. localfile="$VIRTUAL_ENV/log/upper-constraints.txt" if [[ "$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" != http* ]]; then CONSTRAINTS_FILE="file://$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" fi # NOTE(tonyb): need to add curl to bindep.txt if the project supports bindep curl "$CONSTRAINTS_FILE" --insecure --progress-bar --output "$localfile" pip install -c"$localfile" openstack-requirements # This is the main purpose of the script: Allow local installation of # the current repo. It is listed in constraints file and thus any # install will be constrained and we need to unconstrain it. edit-constraints "$localfile" -- "$CLIENT_NAME" pip install -c"$localfile" -U "$@" exit $?

commit_message:
trivial: Modify signature of _filter_non_requested_pfs

The other functions in here have arguments of form (pools, *other_args).
Use the same here.

Change-Id: Ie062f7672f39cda14e3124e623c95bbdc7215a52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/527473/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pools = self._filter_non_requested_pfs(pools, request) @classmethod def _filter_non_requested_pfs(cls, pools, request): pools = cls._filter_pools_for_pfs(pools) return pools matching_pools = self._filter_non_requested_pfs(matching_pools, request)
deleted_lines: pools = self._filter_non_requested_pfs(request, pools) def _filter_non_requested_pfs(self, request, matching_pools): matching_pools = self._filter_pools_for_pfs(matching_pools) return matching_pools matching_pools = self._filter_non_requested_pfs(request, matching_pools)

subject: Add PCI NUMA policies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-12 17:30:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/62aa1ef23d9329ea93d80ce91222558a601463d0', 'message': "Add PCI NUMA policies

This patch adds new policies for PCI devices allocation. There are 3
policies:

- legacy - this is the default value and it describes the current nova
  behavior. Nova will boot VMs with PCI device if the PCI device is
  associated with at least one NUMA node on which the instance should
  be booted or there is no information about PCI-NUMA association

- required - nova will boot VMs with PCI devices *only* if at least one
  of the VM's NUMA node is associated with these PCI devices.

- preferred - nova will boot VMs using best effort NUMA affinity

bp share-pci-between-numa-nodes

Change-Id: I46d483f9de6776db1b025f925890624e5e682ada
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add PCI NUMA policies

This patch adds new policies for PCI devices allocation. There are 3
policies:

- legacy - this is the default value and it describes the current nova
  behavior. Nova will boot VMs with PCI device if the PCI device is
  associated with at least one NUMA node on which the instance should
  be booted or there is no information about PCI-NUMA association

- required - nova will boot VMs with PCI devices *only* if at least one
  of the VM's NUMA node is associated with these PCI devices.

- preferred - nova will boot VMs using best effort NUMA affinity

bp share-pci-between-numa-nodes

Change-Id: I46d483f9de6776db1b025f925890624e5e682ada
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/72/527472/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(stephenfin): PCI pools should be a real object, if nothing else but to # allow us to provide documentation on the concept which we can reference numa_policy = None if 'pci_numa_policy' in numa_topology: numa_policy = numa_topology.pci_numa_policy pools, numa_topology.cells, numa_policy, count) @classmethod def _filter_pools_for_numa_cells(cls, pools, numa_cells, numa_policy, requested_count): """Filter out pools with the wrong NUMA affinity, if required. Exclude pools that do not have *suitable* PCI NUMA affinity. ``numa_policy`` determines what *suitable* means, being one of PREFERRED (nice-to-have), LEGACY (must-have-if-available) and REQUIRED (must-have). :param pools: A list of PCI device pool dicts :param numa_cells: A list of host NUMACells to limit possible devices to, or None. :param pci_numa_policy: The PCI NUMA affinity policy to apply. """ requested_policy = numa_policy or fields.PCINUMAAffinityPolicy.LEGACY # Iterate through the various policies in order of strictness. This # means that even if we only *prefer* PCI-NUMA affinity, we will still # attempt to provide it if possible. for policy in (fields.PCINUMAAffinityPolicy.REQUIRED, fields.PCINUMAAffinityPolicy.LEGACY, fields.PCINUMAAffinityPolicy.PREFERRED): filtered_pools = cls._filter_pools_by_numa_policy( pools, numa_cells, policy) if policy == requested_policy: return filtered_pools if (sum(pool['count'] for pool in filtered_pools) >= requested_count): return filtered_pools return [] def _filter_pools_by_numa_policy(pools, numa_cells, policy): if policy == fields.PCINUMAAffinityPolicy.PREFERRED: return pools numa_cells = [cell.id for cell in numa_cells] if policy == fields.PCINUMAAffinityPolicy.LEGACY: # Some systems don't report numa node info for pci devices, in # that case None is reported in pci_device.numa_node, by adding # None to numa_cells we allow assigning those devices to instances # with numa topology numa_cells.append(None) def _apply_request(self, pools, request, numa_cells=None, numa_policy=None): """Apply a PCI request. Apply a PCI request against a given set of PCI device pools, which are collections of devices with similar traits. If ``numa_cells``, a list of host NUMA cells, is provided then ``pci_numa_policy`` will be used to determine how strict any PCI device(s) must be affinitized to the host cells in this list. :param pools: A list of PCI device pool dicts :param numa_cells: A list of host NUMACells to limit possible devices to, or None. :param numa_policy: The PCI NUMA affinity policy to apply when filtering devices from ``numa_cells``. """ # Firstly, let's exclude all devices that don't match our spec (e.g. # they've got different PCI IDs or something) # Next, let's exclude all devices that aren't on the correct NUMA node # *assuming* we have devices and care about that, as determined by # policy numa_cells, numa_policy, count) # Finally, if we're not requesting PFs then we should not use these. # Exclude them. # Do we still have any devices left? def support_requests(self, requests, numa_cells=None, pci_numa_policy=None): """Determine if the PCI requests can be met. Scheduler checks compute node's PCI stats to decide if an instance can be scheduled into the node. Support does not mean real allocation. If ``numa_cells`` is provided then ``pci_numa_policy`` will be used to determine how strict the PCI device should be affinitized to the host cells in this list. :param pci_requests: A list of requested PCI devices. :type pci_requests: List[nova.objects.InstancePCIRequests] :param numa_cells: A list of host numacells to limit possible devices to, or None. :param pci_numa_policy: The PCI NUMA affinity policy to apply when filtering devices from ``numa_cells``. return all(self._apply_request(pools, r, numa_cells, pci_numa_policy) for r in requests) def apply_requests(self, requests, numa_cells=None, pci_numa_policy=None): If ``numa_cells`` is provided then ``pci_numa_policy`` will be used to determine how strict the PCI device should be affinitized to the host cells in this list. :param pci_requests: A list of requested PCI devices. :type pci_requests: nova.objects.InstancePCIRequests :param numa_cells: A list of host NUMACells to limit possible devices to, or None. :param pci_numa_policy: The PCI NUMA affinity policy to apply when filtering devices from ``numa_cells``. if not all(self._apply_request(self.pools, r, numa_cells, pci_numa_policy) for r in requests):
deleted_lines: pools, numa_topology.cells) def _filter_pools_for_numa_cells(pools, numa_cells): # Some systems don't report numa node info for pci devices, in # that case None is reported in pci_device.numa_node, by adding None # to numa_cells we allow assigning those devices to instances with # numa topology numa_cells = [None] + [cell.id for cell in numa_cells] def _apply_request(self, pools, request, numa_cells=None): numa_cells) def support_requests(self, requests, numa_cells=None): """Check if the pci requests can be met. Scheduler checks compute node's PCI stats to decide if an instance can be scheduled into the node. Support does not mean real allocation. If numa_cells is provided then only devices contained in those nodes are considered. return all([self._apply_request(pools, r, numa_cells) for r in requests]) def apply_requests(self, requests, numa_cells=None): If numa_cells is provided then only devices contained in those nodes are considered. if not all([self._apply_request(self.pools, r, numa_cells) for r in requests]):

commit_message:
Avoid to overrdie entire policy file

We should not override entire policy file, this might cause error to
other services (like Tacker) who also try to override Heat policy file.

Change-Id: I349de4b5e78fd6807db646543e3ac69212f304e9

networking-ovn setups.

commit_message:
Implement get_unique_role_by_name

Implement a convenience method in the role manager to look up a single role
by its name. This is useful for moving role-specific logic out of the
trust controller and will be useful again for application credentials
which will also need to look up roles by name.

Change-Id: I94083cd4e719f105b5555e4676e119a358d6b1c6

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Shutdown tcpdump process gracefully

In fullstack test for dscp marking packets tcpdump is used to capture
packets send from one namespace (Fake VM) to another one.
When tcpdump is closed quickly with SIGKILL signal it may not displays
all packets and that might cause an issue with failed dscp marking test.

Now tcpdump will be kill with SIGINT signal so it should display
all captured packets to the stdout.
Also it should now return to stderr summary of all captured/dropped
packets which can be helpful in future debugging of issue with those
tests if that will not solve the problem.

Change-Id: Ib2d588d081a48f4f2b6e98a943bca95b9955a149
Related-Bug: #1733649
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/530212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
kolla: override mysql packages for sensu

Kolla deploys Sensu with MariaDB-client but in TripleO we want to deploy
Galera package built in RDO. So like we do for mariadb_packages, we'll
override sensu_client_packages with what is needed to have mariadb
client.

Depends-On: I30092400142af5c3308534a8da9daa22cbb82bad
Change-Id: I928fc32654216d331d04722773b300285e8148d2

commit_message:
Add architecture check when downloading helm and kubectl

There is an issue that setup-kubectl.sh and setup-helm.sh can only
download helm and kubectl for X86_64, but it cannot handle other
architectrues like arm64 or ppc64le.
This patch detects architecture and make the script architecture-aware,
so the script can download proper helm and kubectl for the corresponding
arm64 and ppc64le architectures, in addition to X86_64.

Closes-Bug: #1738743

Change-Id: I58a39268040797fdb3e39b9ff10b2cd7e0822386
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/56/528656/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash function is_arch { [[ "$(uname -m)" == "$1" ]] } if is_arch "x86_64"; then ARCH="amd64" elif is_arch "aarch64"; then ARCH="arm64" elif is_arch "ppc64le"; then ARCH="ppc64le" else ARCH=$(uname -m) exit "Kolla Kubernetes unsupported architecture $ARCH" fi

commit_message:
fs010: switch tempest test to test_network_basic_ops

fs010 has too many timeouts in upstream CI, we'll stop to deploy some
services, Cinder included (already covered by 2 other scenarios).

So we want to run test_network_basic_ops instead of the boot from
volume.

Change-Id: I2a4aa707fa10664f1fc9026e3eb417f35834436f

commit_message:
Create 8GB file on subnodes

In CI we have /root/swapfile of 8GB on every node mounted as swap,
and it's critical for TripleO deployments which fails without it
because of memory lack.
Create such file on every subnode.

Change-Id: Id2e6237c603320eefb7a76512dbb544263614c71

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more detials information, please refer to:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

commit_message:
Add out-of-date warning to openstack-helm gates README

Adds a warning to the gate docs README to indicate the scripts
are out of date. This points all single-node development and
evaluation purposes to the current all-in-one deployment docs.

Change-Id: Id6899ef568bda388ed82a70aa7fdacfe60bd8cb0

commit_message:
[WIP][PoC] RCPAPI microversion constants

Change-Id: Idad308b0cec7fe655c264d3847270c1ffb3830d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/17/427817/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Drop 2.x compatibility - Remove promote_replica and reenable_replication. This is non-backward compatible, but the user-facing API was removed back in Mitaka when introducing cheesecake replication. - Adds support for sending objects over RPC in get_backup_device(). - Adds support for sending objects over RPC in attach_volume(). - Adds support for sending objects over RPC in detach_volume(). - Adds support for cluster in retype and migrate_volume - Switch to use oslo.messaging topics to indicate backends instead of @backend suffixes in server names. - Adds do_cleanup method to do volume cleanups from other nodes that we were doing in init_host. - Make failover_host cluster aware and add failover_completed. - Adds new attach/detach methods - Returning objects instead of raw dictionaries in get_manageable_volumes & get_manageable_snapshots VERSION_REGISTRY = rpc.VersionRegistry(3) # Remove promote_replica and reenable_replication. VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() # Adds support for sending objects over RPC in get_backup_device(). V_OVO_GBD = VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() # Adds support for sending objects over RPC in attach_volume(). V_OVO_AV = VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() # Adds support for sending objects over RPC in detach_volume(). V_OVO_DV = VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() # Adds support for cluster in retype and migrate_volume. V_CL_RMV = VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() # Switch to use oslo.messaging topics to indicate backends instead # of @backend suffixes in server names. V_OMT = VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() # Adds do_cleanup method to do volume cleanups from other nodes # that we were doing in init_host. V_DC = VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() # Make failover_host cluster aware and add failover_completed. V_FH_FC = VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() # Adds new attach/detach methods. V_AD = VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() # Returning objects instead of raw dictionaries in # get_manageable_volumes & get_manageable_snapshots V_OVO_MVMS = VERSION_REGISTRY.new_change() RPC_API_VERSION = VERSION_REGISTRY.version RPC_DEFAULT_VERSION = VERSION_REGISTRY.default_version # TODO(dulek): If we're pinned before V_OMT, we should send stuff # the old way: addressing server=host@backend, topic=cinder-volume. if self.client.can_send_version(self.V_OMT): cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume.service_topic_queue, (self.V_OVO_AV, self.VERSION_REGISTRY.default_version)) if not cctxt.can_send_version(self.V_OVO_AV): cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume.service_topic_queue, (self.V_OVO_DV, self.VERSION_REGISTRY.default_version)) if not self.client.can_send_version(self.V_OVO_DV): version = self.V_CL_RMV if not self.client.can_send_version(self.V_CL_RMV): version = self.VERSION_REGISTRY.default_version version = self.V_CL_RMV if not self.client.can_send_version(version): version = self.VERSION_REGISTRY.default_version version = self.V_FH_FC version = self.VERSION_REGISTRY.default_version cctxt = self._get_cctxt(service.service_topic_queue, self.V_FH_FC, cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume.service_topic_queue, (self.V_OVO_GBD, self.VERSION_REGISTRY.default_version)) if cctxt.can_send_version(self.V_OVO_GBD): version = (self.V_OVO_MVMS, self.VERSION_REGISTRY.default_version) if cctxt.can_send_version(self.V_OVO_MVMS): version = (self.V_OVO_MVMS, self.VERSION_REGISTRY.default_version) if cctxt.can_send_version(self.V_OVO_MVMS): @rpc.assert_min_rpc_version(V_AD) def attachment_update(self, ctxt, vref, connector, attachment_id): version = self._compat_ver(self.V_AD) @rpc.assert_min_rpc_version(V_AD) def attachment_delete(self, ctxt, attachment_id, vref): version = self._compat_ver(self.V_AD) @rpc.assert_min_rpc_version(V_DC) cctxt = self._get_cctxt(destination, self.V_DC)
deleted_lines: 3.0 - Drop 2.x compatibility 3.1 - Remove promote_replica and reenable_replication. This is non-backward compatible, but the user-facing API was removed back in Mitaka when introducing cheesecake replication. 3.2 - Adds support for sending objects over RPC in get_backup_device(). 3.3 - Adds support for sending objects over RPC in attach_volume(). 3.4 - Adds support for sending objects over RPC in detach_volume(). 3.5 - Adds support for cluster in retype and migrate_volume 3.6 - Switch to use oslo.messaging topics to indicate backends instead of @backend suffixes in server names. 3.7 - Adds do_cleanup method to do volume cleanups from other nodes that we were doing in init_host. 3.8 - Make failover_host cluster aware and add failover_completed. 3.9 - Adds new attach/detach methods 3.10 - Returning objects instead of raw dictionaries in get_manageable_volumes & get_manageable_snapshots RPC_API_VERSION = '3.10' RPC_DEFAULT_VERSION = '3.0' # TODO(dulek): If we're pinned before 3.6, we should send stuff the # old way - addressing server=host@backend, topic=cinder-volume. if self.client.can_send_version('3.6'): cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume.service_topic_queue, ('3.3', '3.0')) if not cctxt.can_send_version('3.3'): cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume.service_topic_queue, ('3.4', '3.0')) if not self.client.can_send_version('3.4'): version = '3.5' if not self.client.can_send_version(version): version = '3.0' version = '3.5' if not self.client.can_send_version(version): version = '3.0' version = '3.8' version = '3.0' cctxt = self._get_cctxt(service.service_topic_queue, '3.8', cctxt = self._get_cctxt(volume.service_topic_queue, ('3.2', '3.0')) if cctxt.can_send_version('3.2'): version = ('3.10', '3.0') if cctxt.can_send_version('3.10'): version = ('3.10', '3.0') if cctxt.can_send_version('3.10'): @rpc.assert_min_rpc_version('3.9') def attachment_update(self, ctxt, vref, connector, attachment_id): version = self._compat_ver('3.9') @rpc.assert_min_rpc_version('3.9') def attachment_delete(self, ctxt, attachment_id, vref): version = self._compat_ver('3.9') @rpc.assert_min_rpc_version('3.7') cctxt = self._get_cctxt(destination, '3.7')

Convert dict to OVO in backup export_record rpcapi

It returns a backup_record as a dict, but should be modelled as OVO.

subject: RBD: get replication flags from 'diff'.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-18 06:03:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/30aa33dddd2e8ac8c4b1602c5ad63cd31e508e25', 'message': "RBD: get replication flags from 'diff' instead of volume type

There are two types of volume_type, it can be an instance of
VolumeType or dictionary, because the cinder api or volume
manager get it by using different database api. When retyping a
volume, the manager gets the new volume_type by using volume_type
id, and the database api converts the qeury result to dictionary.
In other cases, if volume_type is just a part of a volume, we get
it at the same time when getting the volume from database by using
volume_id, and the database api will not convert the result to
dictionary. The method '_is_replicated_type' ignores the first case,
it may get an incorrect value for specs.
In order to get rid of this situation, when retyping a volume, we
can get replication flags from 'diff' instead of using the method
'_is_replicated_type'.

commit_message:
RBD: get replication flags from 'diff'.

There are two types of volume_type, it can be an instance of
VolumeType or dictionary, because the cinder api or volume
manager get it by using different database api. When retyping a
volume, the manager gets the new volume_type by using volume_type
id, and the database api converts the qeury result to dictionary.
In other cases, if volume_type is just a part of a volume, we get
it at the same time when getting the volume from database by using
volume_id, and the database api will not convert the result to
dictionary. The method '_is_replicated_type' ignores the first case,
it may get an incorrect value for specs.
In order to get rid of this situation, when retyping a volume, we
can get replication flags from 'diff' instead of using the method
'_is_replicated_type'.

Change-Id: I9777454ecc12b10bc99254b0bedd24707cfc9f6a
Closes-Bug: #1653917

commit_message:
Glance: Update RBD pool management to better support luminious

This PS updates the RBD pool management job to better support
luminious, which expects an application to be assigned to the pool.

Change-Id: I6c77853c761491ddc42171a3521b70518d63242a

commit_message:
Handle binding__host_id conditionally

binding__host_id (binding:host_id in the Neutron API) only exists
when portbinding neutron extension is available. This extension is
available in almost all cases as Nova depends on the extension,
but it is better to check the availability in horizon side as
we do so in other places in horizon.

Change-Id: Id7fa8ebcdde09547fd64892a787834bc4c543acf
Closes-Bug: #1498352

commit_message:
Allow empty compute group when ironic is in use

If ironic is in use it is valid to have no (virtualised) compute nodes.

Change-Id: I100540fbfd81be5642c1d4ed135fcd500924a47e
Closes-Bug: #1701317

commit_message:
Support shared IP address range

* Add support for range of shared IPs using
  new class SharedIpRange

* Add support for shared IPs on non-external
  networks, floating IP not available in
  this case

Change-Id: I7faa946e99d0070c375408b7f18546a281c668d4
Closes-Bug: #1727349

commit_message:
Gate: simplify helm release log gathering

This PS simplifys the helm release log gathering, to collect logs
from all charts released into the cluster, and also adds a `logs`
sub-target to the dev-deploy target in the Makefile.

Change-Id: I016a5e08163eaccf13331db6faa45fab1e9cf4f2

commit_message:
Remove legacy-neutron-dsvm-api from Neutron

Job legacy-neutron-dsvm-api is being moved to the Neutron repo in [1].
As a consequencen job legacy-neutron-dsvm-api is being removed from this
repo, per the steps indicated in [2]

[1] I3764a77aa989d773ca880272b15f8185c2d7d057
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#moving-legacy-jobs-to-projects

Needed-By: I51704c7b1a852e429225ee082c9b024f6ce7a947
Depends-On: I3764a77aa989d773ca880272b15f8185c2d7d057

Change-Id: I0d4f8da94d7ec0c717c408f9d85b6cd1b00d05a7

commit_message:
Fix "Open Console" issue on network topology

Now when user click the link "Open Console" on the instance balloon of
network topology panel, two windows will be opened. This patch fixes
that.

Closes-Bug: #1702189

Change-Id: I7459e990cac4c6df79c4972e2d5b5b4dee9eb428
(cherry picked from commit db4c47d2528dddf657794a9ebb6b722deaa5d1fe)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-20 18:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/default-keystone-api-v3-dc201adba4255752.yaml', 'doc/source/admin/customize-configure.rst', 'doc/source/configuration/settings.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'openstack_auth/utils.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/settings.py', 'doc/source/contributor/quickstart.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/cd495108780a3545fffb5bd04d2c2c24b0818f54', 'message': 'Updating default keystone API verson to 3

The keystone API version 3 has become the default API version
for a long time and our CI already uses keystone v3 API only.

In addition, our documentation recommended to use the cached session,
so switching the default API version to 3 does not hit the limitation
on the maximum size of session data when using the cookie-based
sessions.

This is based on django_opensatck_auth review

Implements blueprint: default-keystone-api-3
Change-Id: I79e9fbd3567cc69468694dbf043fecf422347c7e
'}]
commit_message:
Updating default keystone API verson to 3

The keystone API version 3 has become the default API version
for a long time and our CI already uses keystone v3 API only.

In addition, our documentation recommended to use the cached session,
so switching the default API version to 3 does not hit the limitation
on the maximum size of session data when using the cookie-based
sessions.

This is based on django_opensatck_auth review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158384/

Implements blueprint: default-keystone-api-3
Change-Id: I79e9fbd3567cc69468694dbf043fecf422347c7e

commit_message:
Cinder: Enable backup

This PS enables the cinder backup service, for RBD, Swift and Posix
based backups.

commit_message:
RBAC: Fix issue with inclusion of empty jobs or daemonsets

Currently, the rbac logic would allow for ``jobs`` or ``daemonsets``
if it is specified in the dependencies, even if they may just be empty
or null.  This patch set addresses this by checking the jobs or
daemonsets map in the value.yaml is non-empty before including it
in the Role.

Change-Id: I67f940e1e71c371b63d8d1e9b4f47af633a6bfa4

commit_message:
RBAC: Fix issue with inclusion of empty jobs or daemonsets

Currently, the rbac logic would allow for ``jobs`` or ``daemonsets``
if it is specified in the dependencies, even if they may just be empty
or null.  This patch set addresses this by checking the jobs or
daemonsets map in the value.yaml is non-empty before including it
in the Role.

This mirrors the fix in OSH-infra in [0].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530337/1

Change-Id: I37e8d8c1a0d587410811c544e049bbafed73cba8
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

When installing MapR into a cluster on CentOS 7, the plugin tries to download epel release version 7-8 from the url http://download.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/7/x86_64/e/epel-release-7-8.noarch.rpm.

    release=`cat /etc/*-release`

    else
        echo "Unsupported distribution version"
        exit 1
    fi

commit_message:
Fixing epel-release bug on MapR cluster installation

When installing MapR into a cluster on CentOS 7, the plugin tries to
download epel release version 7-8 from the url http://download.
fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/7/x86_64/e/epel-release-7-8.noarch.rpm.
This release version is not available anymore and should be replaced
with epel-release-7-9 on the url rpm -i http://download.
fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/7/x86_64/e/epel-release-7-9.noarch.rpm
bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/sahara/+bug/1615761 is because 7-5，
why can not replace with yum install -y epel-release to solve the
problem permanently in /opt/stack/sahara/sahara/plugins/mapr/
resources/add_mapr_repo.sh(31).

Closes-Bug:#1657048

Change-Id: I7705be363e99f10472dbf0ea3bb189228cbaf65f

commit_message:
Use mock for HTTP calls in unit tests

In test environment without network access, test_retry_policy_from_var
failed to run as it was not expecting the DNS lookup error. Mocking
the HTTP calls instead helps getting this pass.

Change-Id: I050aba6a90dc13200e1cded2195bdf5caf43367b

commit_message:
Gracefully handle DB disconnected connect errors

When the DB is disconnected, the Mistral API should retry the
operation for a predefined amount of time at least for GET
type requests as this error is highly probable to be caused
by temporary failures. The handlind of Operational errors
was already implemented.

Change-Id: I3adb94dd695aeaa40d37956beae088d5618422c3

commit_message:
Add verify_ca configuration parameter

Added configuration parameter, verify_ca, to magnum.conf with default
value of True. This parameter is passed to the heat templates to
indicate whether the cluster nodes validate the Certificate Authority
when making requests to the OpenStack APIs (Keystone, Magnum, Heat).
This configuration parameter can be set to False to disable CA
validation.

Co-Authored-By: Vijendar Komalla <vijendar.komalla@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Iab02cb1338b811dac0c147378dbd0e63c83f0413
Partial-Bug: #1663757

trivial: Rename 'policy_check' -> 'policy'

The executable is 'nova-policy' - not 'nova-policy-check'.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
XenAPI: Unit tests must mock os_xenapi calls

To prevent internal changes in os_xenapi from breaking nova unit
tests, we must mock os_xenapi calls (particular around session
management) rather than attempting to mock the internals of os_xenapi.
This issue was introduced when os_xenapi was split out from nova,
but the UT were not similarly abstracted

Change-Id: Ifdcddb63f64d5759640a62e8ddd3c276fa4fc743

subject: Calculated deploy timeout dynamically in CI

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-17 14:32:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/1cbb1bc98a54198b332a2070268318492136c3c6', 'message': "Calculated deploy timeout dynamically in CI

Calculated overcloud deploy timeout dynamically, basing on
environment variables set in CI.
REMAINING_TIME is variable set by infra which defines how long will
job continue until it's killed by zuul with timeout. START_JOB_TIME
is variable set in main toci script for defining when job actually
started. The difference between them and current time gives us the
time remaining in job. 10 minutes is left for logs collection and
5 minutes is for tripleo-inventory to add overcloud nodes.
General timeout for playbook run remains as is.

Close-Bug: #1738038
Change-Id: Icada6006377e0f27ea9a71ffad3320c99dd15e76

commit_message:
Calculated deploy timeout dynamically in CI

Calculated overcloud deploy timeout dynamically, basing on
passed ci_job_end_time variable in CI.
The difference between it and current time gives us the
time remaining in job. 10 minutes is left for logs collection
and 5 minutes is for tripleo-inventory to add overcloud nodes.
General timeout for playbook run remains as is.

Depends-On: I89b743fc16ea4c100ba21ddbe29081fa3e5479e9
Closes-Bug: #1738038

Change-Id: Icada6006377e0f27ea9a71ffad3320c99dd15e76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/65/528565/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # 15 is "reserved time for logs=10" + 5 minutes for inventory role - name: Calculate overcloud deploy timeout according to CI env variables shell: echo $(( REMAINING_TIME - ($(date +%s) - START_JOB_TIME)/60 - 15)) register: timeout_calculation - name: Set overcloud deployment timeout in CI set_fact: deploy_timeout: "{{ timeout_calculation.stdout }}" when: '{{ timeout_calculation.stdout }} > 0'

commit_message:
Remove dsvm prefix from in-repo zuul jobs

This PS removes the "dsvm" prefix from job names; this is a legacy
change which infra documentation says should be avoided [0]

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#naming-with-zuul-v3

Change-Id: Ib92071a04852867a3c7a0f3dedc4d783c5de1055

commit_message:
Make chef agent tests more reliable

They fail sometimes on py35 because we rely on dict order in asserts.
Let's remove that and load json instead.

Change-Id: I7bff32028cc130128ce05c151534c85ef99607d5

commit_message:
Revert "debian: import key for download.ceph.com repository"

We no longer use ceph from upstream as it does not support Debian
'stretch'.`

This reverts commit d4017985a574b6e4eab90213e6f383ef7912b0a3.

Change-Id: Ia363bf93429ea917f242c4a24d78853cf43c95ff

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for kuryr

Provide support for kolla dev mode in Kuryr. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'kuryr_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Kuryr project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: I74c1ea70b4220a0e91f19403971303ca55652371

commit_message:
Added playbooks to install ELK stack with topbeat

This set of playbooks install an Elasticsearch cluster,
Logstash and a kibana dashboard inside containers
and then install Topbeat in your cloud to ship system metrics
to the Elastic cluster.

Change-Id: I0c8c853ee48bd9278bd7b08719be4bde5f8c3df6

added_lines: # ---------------------------------- Cluster ----------------------------------- cluster.name: {{ cluster_name }} # ------------------------------------ Node ------------------------------------ node.name: {{ node_name }} # node.rack: r1 # ----------------------------------- Paths ------------------------------------ # Path to directory where to store the data (separate multiple locations by comma): # # path.data: /path/to/data # # Path to log files: # # path.logs: /path/to/logs # ----------------------------------- Memory ----------------------------------- # # Lock the memory on startup: # # bootstrap.memory_lock: true # # Make sure that the `ES_HEAP_SIZE` environment variable is set to about half the memory # available on the system and that the owner of the process is allowed to use this limit. # # Elasticsearch performs poorly when the system is swapping the memory. # # ---------------------------------- Network ----------------------------------- # # Set the bind address to a specific IP (IPv4 or IPv6): network.host: {{ elastic_interface }} # Set a custom port for HTTP: http.port: {{ elastic_port }} # --------------------------------- Discovery ---------------------------------- # # Pass an initial list of hosts to perform discovery when new node is started: # The default list of hosts is ["127.0.0.1", "[::1]"] # discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts: {% set IP_ARR=[] %}{% for host in groups['elastic-logstash'] | union(groups['kibana']) %}{% if IP_ARR.insert(loop.index,hostvars[host]['ansible_ssh_host']) %}{% endif %}{% endfor %}[{{ IP_ARR | join(', ') }}] node.master: {{ node_master | default(true) }} node.data: {{ node_data | default(true) }} # # Prevent the "split brain" by configuring the majority of nodes (total number of nodes / 2 + 1): # # discovery.zen.minimum_master_nodes: 3 # # For more information, see the documentation at: # <http://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-discovery.html> # # ---------------------------------- Gateway ----------------------------------- # # Block initial recovery after a full cluster restart until N nodes are started: # # gateway.recover_after_nodes: 3 # # For more information, see the documentation at: # <http://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-gateway.html> # # ---------------------------------- Various ----------------------------------- # # Disable starting multiple nodes on a single system: # # node.max_local_storage_nodes: 1 # # Require explicit names when deleting indices: # # action.destructive_requires_name: true

commit_message:
Fix influxdb-relay port on haproxy configuration

The port assigned to influxdb-relay is conflicting with the one
already assigned to influxdb, making haproxy never able to bring
up influxdb-relay service.

Change-Id: I348423dbf16fc2be2e1ef41ce2e13ffe34d4e66e

commit_message:
remove meaningless if statement

The statement is always True since is_shared_block_storage is just
merely a `not destroy_disks` (see _live_migration_cleanup_flags)

Change-Id: I868cfabb03335cce9af1e455f69ff10214e58c6d
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>

The tight coupling is not great... instance.system_metadata['clean_attempts'] = str(attempts + 1) if success: instance.cleaned = True instance.save()

commit_message:
Add "list projects for a single-project user" test

Though users can belong to multiple projects, making users
multi-tenant is not considered advisable. This test checks
to make sure that:
1) the user belongs to only one project
2) the name of the user's project is the same as that stored
   as part of the user's credentials.
Change-Id: I4db28a22148ff16590f296d68a22d13a2353de46

added_lines: @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): cls.primary_project_name = cls.os_primary.credentials.project_name cls.alt_project_name = cls.os_alt.credentials.project_name project_name=self.alt_project_name, @decorators.idempotent_id('caaed452-653a-4efe-ad86-279a4e11b4e9') def test_list_projects_with_name(self): self._list_projects_with_params( {'name': self.primary_project_name}, 'name') def _list_projects_with_params(self, params, key): body = self.non_admin_users_client.list_user_projects( self.os_primary.credentials.user_id)['projects'] self.assertIn(self.primary_project_name, map(lambda x: x[key], body)) self.assertNotIn(self.alt_project_name, map(lambda x: x[key], body))

commit_message:
Drop MariaDB offical repo and percona repo

MariaDB package is provided by the linux distro already. No need add
MariaDB offical repo.

percona-xtrabackup is provided by Ubuntu offical repo and CentOS epel
repo. No need add percoan offical repo.

Change-Id: I85509cfa0ac5e61283ec4852807e5693eeae8d8f

commit_message:
Select host that has compute service for show_host

show_host(or nove host-describe) can only be applied to
compute nodes, otherwise we will get "ERROR (NotFound):
Host 'controllr01' is not mapped to any cell (HTTP 404)"

This is to select one compute node for the result of list_host,
just as test_show_host_detail do.
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/e31581afeacf785fe2c67968563e67b061fbcc13/tempest/api/compute/admin/test_hosts.py#L60

Change-Id: Iba8a35b88b405cd49d136aa60f77c101b5b1d3cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/36/530436/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: hosts = [host for host in hosts if host['service'] == 'compute']

commit_message:
heat moved to policy in code

create a policy.yaml to change the default behavior

Change-Id: I84708d64188c2fa6d8555182e024efec85edbe2c

added_lines: # To enable vitragebehaviortack add an entry to local.conf that cat << EOF > /etc/heat/policy.yaml # List stacks globally. # GET /v1/{tenant_id}/stacks "stacks:global_index": "rule:deny_stack_user" EOF

commit_message:
Replace colon with a dash.

IPv6 addresses have colons
as separators, in this case
we cant name an order with colons.

To preserve the IPv6 address we
can replace it with a dash.

Change-Id: I87a1fb8952081dcb49f64ffff62414df120dccac
Closes-bug: 1740261
(cherry picked from commit 08a6ceda8df79f1bf0674b818225b43e5543ef7e)

subnet: { get_param: subnet } weight: 222 ''' def setUp(self): super(LoadBalancerv2Test, self).setUp() if not self.is_network_extension_supported('lbaasv2'): self.skipTest('LBaasv2 extension not 'listener') self.assertEqual(7777, output['connection_limit']) self.assertEqual('updatedListener', output['description']) def test_add_delete_poolmember(self): parameters = { 'subnet': self.conf.fixed_subnet_name, } stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=self.create_template, parameters=parameters) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) output = self._stack_output(stack, 'loadbalancer') self.assertEqual('ONLINE', output['operating_status']) output = self._stack_output(stack, 'pool') self.assertEqual(1, len(output['members'])) # add pool member template = self.create_template.replace('# pm2', self.add_member) self.update_stack(stack_identifier, template=template, parameters=parameters) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) output = self._stack_output(stack, 'loadbalancer') self.assertEqual('ONLINE', output['operating_status']) output = self._stack_output(stack, 'pool') self.assertEqual(2, len(output['members'])) # delete pool member self.update_stack(stack_identifier, template=self.create_template, parameters=parameters) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) output = self._stack_output(stack, commit_message:
Fix get instance status logical error

Reset status set service status to UNKNOWN, not
instance.datastore_status.status
Service status should be used for checking force-deleting.

Related: Ida4d460f6fbf3eb7029fe5ef0091c7f9e0816b25

Change-Id: I7ae177bb5f4b12a99f25428ee18433ce475ecdf1

commit_message:
Allow passing extra vars when generating static inventory

This is needed because the undercloud deploy command uses the
"undercloud" stack name, which overwrites the hard-coded
undercloud inventory content, so we lose ansible_connection
settings to force a local connection.

Change-Id: Id9dfb8e387cf2be09a7bb689ba79f797e998002c

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-12-23 11:17:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/8c46582a7fab624ec31233783686d41e664ba7cb', 'message': "Add write_static_inventory to TripleoInventory class

This is a reimplementation of the similarly names function in
tripleo-ansible-inventory, but this outputs yaml format instead
of the current ini format.

The reason for this change is getting consistent behavior of the
configparser module for unit tests over py27 & py35 is difficult,
and also some of the roles_data keys I plan to add in a subsequent
commit can't easily be represented in the ini format (particularly
lists don't seem to work, everything must be a string value).

The tripleo-ansible-inventory script can be changed to use this
interface, and we'll have to deprecate the current ini based interface.

Change-Id: Ia3c6b9931e2d38507917cd80a93857d952784bd2
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-12-27 18:36:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/3d29120c767b123a1cf063d0b60fd84f8669d62a', 'message': "Add write_static_inventory to TripleoInventory class

"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2017-12-28 11:39:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/d60690163bd55e723771c56980b3d2036030cc56', 'message': "Add write_static_inventory to TripleoInventory class

This is a reimplementation of the similarly names function in
tripleo-ansible-inventory, but this outputs yaml format instead
of the current ini format.

The reason for this change is getting consistent behavior of the
configparser module for unit tests over py27 & py35 is difficult,
and also some of the roles_data keys I plan to add in a subsequent
commit can't easily be represented in the ini format (particularly
lists don't seem to work, everything must be a string value).

The tripleo-ansible-inventory script can be changed to use this

commit_message:
Add write_static_inventory to TripleoInventory class

This is a reimplementation of the similarly names function in
tripleo-ansible-inventory, but this outputs yaml format instead
of the current ini format.

The reason for this change is getting consistent behavior of the
configparser module for unit tests over py27 & py35 is difficult,
and also some of the roles_data keys I plan to add in a subsequent
commit can't easily be represented in the ini format (particularly
lists don't seem to work, everything must be a string value).

The tripleo-ansible-inventory script can be changed to use this
interface, and we'll have to deprecate the current ini based interface.

Change-Id: Ia3c6b9931e2d38507917cd80a93857d952784bd2

commit_message:
container sync: reraise properly, don't log traceback for ClientExceptions

Also, stop making assertions in fakes -- they don't have the right stack
for that to detect failures properly.

Change-Id: If0e7e13b9072fae945436b626b875391034af3ab

commit_message:
Rename elasticsearch configmaps and provide config via toYaml

This brings the elasticsearch configmaps, volume and mount names
inline with other charts by naming them after the service.

This also moves the configuration for elasticsearch to the values
file to bring it inline with other charts that do the same

Change-Id: I61f7c740d830a9a0567f8b72a0f815a09407b90c

commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Add curator snapshot action and PVC for fs repo

This provides an example action in the curator config for taking
snapshots of the elasticsearch indexes. As the snapshot action
requires a repository registered with Elasticsearch, this also
adds a PVC for a filesystem repository backed with NFS and a job
for registering the repository with Elasticsearch.

Change-Id: I26b788c58f52844e997bde5002459bddc1bb685e

See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. */}} set -ex exec curl -XPUT "${ELASTICSEARCH_ENDPOINT}/_snapshot/${REPO_NAME}" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d' { "type": "${REPO_TYPE}", "settings": { "location": "${REPO_LOCATION}", "compress": true } }

commit_message:
Remove rolling_upgrade_password_hash_compat

The config option ``rolling_upgrade_password_hash_compat``
is only used for rolling-upgrade from Ocata release to
Pike release. It should be removed now.

Change-Id: Ic9bb5809b40a120f92c801b8c0d37608a7976105
bp: removed-as-of-queens

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-11 22:23:20.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/fa00f12c4d85c5b0319fda65500b4f779f9e063d', 'message': "Rearrange server caching

Change-Id: I6f74e942d4211cc3ce0fbc0722776786ff494b86
"}]
commit_message:
Rearrange server caching

Shift around where we do the caching so that we're caching the
appropriate remote content. We don't need to cache detailed and bare
differently as they are flags that control client-side post-processing.

Change-Id: I6f74e942d4211cc3ce0fbc0722776786ff494b86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/53/527253/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: filters = filters or {} if self._SERVER_AGE == 0 or self.use_direct_get: params = filters else: params = {} if all_projects: params['all_tenants'] = True cache_key = _generate_cache_key(name='servers', **params) servers = None if not servers: if not got_lock: cache_key_lock.acquire() try: cached_value = self._servers_cache.get(cache_key) if cached_value: servers, saved_time = cached_value if (time.time() - saved_time) >= self._SERVER_AGE: servers = None if servers is None: servers = self._list_servers(params) self._servers_cache[cache_key] = (servers, time.time()) finally: cache_key_lock.release() return [ self._expand_server(server, detailed, bare) for server in _utils._filter_list(servers, None, filters) ] def _list_servers(self, params): return self._normalize_servers(self._get_and_munchify( 'servers', self._compute_client.get( '/servers/detail', params=params, error_message=error_msg)))
deleted_lines: cache_key = (detailed, all_projects, bare, filters) return servers if not got_lock: cache_key_lock.acquire() try: servers = None try: servers, saved_time = self._servers_cache[cache_key] if (time.time() - saved_time) >= self._SERVER_AGE: servers = None except KeyError: pass if servers is None: servers = self._list_servers(detailed=detailed, all_projects=all_projects, bare=bare, filters=filters) self._servers_cache[cache_key] = (servers, time.time()) return servers finally: cache_key_lock.release() def _list_servers(self, detailed=False, all_projects=False, bare=False, filters=None): params = filters or {} if all_projects: params['all_tenants'] = True data = self._compute_client.get( '/servers/detail', params=params, error_message=error_msg) servers = self._normalize_servers( self._get_and_munchify('servers', data)) return [ self._expand_server(server, detailed, bare) for server in servers ]

commit_message:
Add the StorPool brick connector

Allow clients to attach and detach Cinder volumes stored on
a StorPool cluster.

Change-Id: I33cfd7ab9a1d201f6c49357cacb4a809453b7201
Implements:	blueprint brick-add-storpool-driver

added_lines: elif protocol == "STORPOOL": return StorPoolConnector(driver=driver, execute=execute, root_helper=root_helper, *args, **kwargs) class StorPoolConnector(InitiatorConnector): def __init__(self, root_helper, driver=None, execute=putils.execute, *args, **kwargs): self._execute = execute self._root_helper = root_helper try: from storpool import spopenstack except ImportError: raise exception.BrickException(_LE( 'Could not import the StorPool API bindings')) try: self._attach = spopenstack.AttachDB(log=LOG) self._attach.api().attachmentsList() except Exception as e: raise exception.BrickException(_LE( 'Could not initialize the StorPool API bindings: %s') % (e)) def connect_volume(self, connection_properties): client_id = connection_properties.get('volume', None) if client_id is None: raise exception.BrickException(_LE( 'Invalid StorPool connection data, no client ID specified')) volume_id = connection_properties.get('volume', None) if volume_id is None: raise exception.BrickException(_LE( 'Invalid StorPool connection data, no volume ID specified')) volume = self._attach.volumeName(volume_id) mode = connection_properties.get('access_mode', None) if mode is None or mode not in ('rw', 'ro'): raise exception.BrickException(_LE( 'Invalid access_mode specified in the connection data')) req_id = 'brick-%s-%s' % (client_id, volume_id) self._attach.add(req_id, { 'volume': volume, 'type': 'brick', 'id': req_id, 'rights': 1 if mode == 'ro' else 2, 'volsnap': False }) self._attach.sync(req_id, None) return {'type': 'block', 'path': '/dev/storpool/' + volume} def disconnect_volume(self, connection_properties, device_info): client_id = connection_properties.get('volume', None) if client_id is None: raise exception.BrickException(_LE( 'Invalid StorPool connection data, no client ID specified')) volume_id = connection_properties.get('volume', None) if volume_id is None: raise exception.BrickException(_LE( 'Invalid StorPool connection data, no volume ID specified')) volume = self._attach.volumeName(volume_id) req_id = 'brick-%s-%s' % (client_id, volume_id) self._attach.sync(req_id, volume) self._attach.remove(req_id)

commit_message:
Move fluentbit and fluentd configs to values.yaml

Defines configuration files for fluentbit and fluentd via the
values.yaml file for fluent-logging. This provides flexibility in
defining parsers and routes for log gathering and routing

This functionality is added via helm-toolkit helper functions for
both fluentd and fluentbit to make the values configuration
cleaner

Change-Id: I8a43f36e487e651561bec8abf7752c8fac68aefc

commit_message:
nova: add an option for no console

On AArch64 we run VMs without any graphics so nova console is not
available. For now we had to disable it by hand but it can be automated.

Change-Id: Ib903044493ca98c0dd29d3096f66272e130668b0
(cherry picked from commit f5fcc868b2e89aaaea03cc2ddfba57b88a491994)

commit_message:
Docs: remove potentially confusing references to versions and RBAC

This PS removes references to out of date versions in the
multinode install guide and also RBAC rules, which was causing
confusion with new developers.

Change-Id: I89ae35896367c17e0d43c1d5b7a9183109aa61df

commit_message:
Better mock out OSErrors in test_replicator before raising them

Also, provide a return value for resp.read() so we hit a
pickle error instead of a type error.

Change-Id: I56141eee63ad1ceb2edf807432fa2516fabb15a6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-28 07:06:24.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/compute/v2/flavor.py', 'doc/source/cli/command-objects/flavor.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/e438c34eaa8335e8727b7dd99a77dc73d37b9d9e', 'message': 'flavor: clarify --swap description

commit_message:
flavor: clarify --swap description

--swap will add a additional storage device,
which not affect the original swap partition/device.

This patch will clarify this misleading description.

Change-Id: Ic079c069985d39cc969b97876901007a81883f57
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/07/530307/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Additional swap space size in MB (default 0M)

commit_message:
QNAP Manila driver: Access rule setting is override by the later rule setting.

When user try to add access rule1 and access rule2, share will first set to
the rule1 and then override by the rule2.

We expect that share should apply both access rule1 and access rule2.

Change-Id: Id77cffb5efe4388e3b66aa85fc89cf6f51d5bd98
Closes-Bug: #1736370

subject: Workaround for virtualenv issue with old variables
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-28 10:35:58.000000000', 'files': ['toci_quickstart.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/95b42be690525a655d86cdf386b50cbb9a9b539b', 'message': "Workaround for virtualenv issue with old variables

When running this script in terminal, it fails with errror
_OLD_VIRTUAL_PATH, _OLD_VIRTUAL_PYTHONHOME is unbound. when
activating virtualenv. Seems like it's known issue in venv:
https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/issues/1029
set +u before activation is a workaround for this issue and then
set -u to continue the rest of the script

Change-Id: I5095118609f8d2dc46112c3761952a109ba4b93e
"}]
commit_message:
Workaround for virtualenv issue with old variables

When running this script in terminal, it fails with errror
_OLD_VIRTUAL_PATH, _OLD_VIRTUAL_PYTHONHOME is unbound. when
activating virtualenv. Seems like it's known issue in venv:
https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/issues/1029
set +u before activation is a workaround for this issue and then
set -u to continue the rest of the script

Change-Id: I5095118609f8d2dc46112c3761952a109ba4b93e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/38/530338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make use of native OVN IPv6 Router Advertisement support

OVN supports Router Solicitation responder i.e it will reply to the
Router Solicitation packets. In order to use this feature, we need
to configure the Logical_Router_Port.ipv6_ra_configs column with the
appropriate values. This patch does that. When a router is added with
an interface port, these values are added.

Support to send periodic Router Advertisement in OVN is under review.
This patch also configures to use this feature by setting
Logical_Router_Port.ipv6_ra_configs:send_periodic='true'. There is no harm
in setting this in this patch.

Change-Id: I5d4d16e517d71830ea16245529dd2ba5433e0fd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/33/529833/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
remove some misleading info in Update user API doc.

the original API tip is 'Update user's password, or Whether...'
Indeed, too detaild tip is more confused. This API can update user,
not just only password or enabled or not.

Change-Id: I93fe1dad635fe0850d9f0e0c2b96cdb1ae7c7752
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/83/528983/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ceph: update dependency logic to be more strict

This PS updates the dependency tree in ceph to take into account
the keyring jobs and also the tollerance for unready endpoints
introduced in the k8s 1.6 era.

Change-Id: If76efeafdbcbe88ee699e7553f0effd5da7ce624

commit_message:
Update bindep.txt for doc builds

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation
specifies that doc dependencies need the doc tag in bindep, use it.

Leave test environment in for transition period until we use the new
scripts.

Change-Id: I36709941ef41e75d5da8594a9b2cb56d40c4838f

commit_message:
Extract cache key function

The inner function in _make_cache_key is useful for the non-dogpile
cases. Extract it so we can use it elsewhere.

Change-Id: I6b0e69215b7405764118e4f179f3b625c0c965d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/52/527252/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _generate_cache_key(name=None, function=None, *args, **kwargs): final_elements = [] for element in name, function: if element: final_elements.append(str(element)) arg_key = ','.join(args) if arg_key: final_elements.append(arg_key) kw_keys = sorted(kwargs.keys()) kwargs_key = ','.join( ['%s:%s' % (k, kwargs[k]) for k in kw_keys if k != 'cache']) if kwargs_key: final_elements.append(kwargs_key) return "_".join(final_elements) function_key_generator=self._make_function_cache_key def _make_function_cache_key(self, namespace, fn): return functools.partial( _generate_cache_key, name=name_key, function=fname)
deleted_lines: function_key_generator=self._make_cache_key def _make_cache_key(self, namespace, fn): def generate_key(*args, **kwargs): arg_key = ','.join(args) kw_keys = sorted(kwargs.keys()) kwargs_key = ','.join( ['%s:%s' % (k, kwargs[k]) for k in kw_keys if k != 'cache']) ans = "_".join( [str(name_key), fname, arg_key, kwargs_key]) return ans return generate_key

Docs: update ceph troubleshooting with luminious data

This PS updates the output from the troubleshooting guide to reflect
the expected output and commands for ceph luminious.

commit_message:
Introduce stable/ocata jobs

Only regular ironic and inspector jobs can run on Ocata. Grenade
cannot run because Newton is EOL, standalone tests were not supported.

Change-Id: I3fe1ae8b29bc3d3ef5d86bb618568aae01452407

commit_message:
Update the list of CI jobs

* Remove multitenant grenade. Grenade jobs only run smoke tests, and ironic
  does not have any.
* Add inspector grenade as inspector actually have a smoke test.
* Add one regular ironic jobs. Other jobs do not cover most of tests we
  have in this plugin.
* Add stable versions for all jobs (ocata versions will follow).

Depends-On: I939ab8c410b39658b4209a41a91c3339802d134b
Depends-On: I4ba2a44bf9b03d85e339bc5761770e8943dd2140
Change-Id: I3603b6a135d184a73bed8046403d046eded3a056

subject: Remove hardcoding of overcloud deploy timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-17 13:06:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/2093357360bc76cc94603b230c12dda14271321b', 'message': "Remove hardcoding of overcloud deploy timeout

Now overcloud deploy timeout is derived from DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT
which is always 170 and equal to 80. It's not appropriate for all
jobs. It will be calculated dynamically depending on how much time
remains in the job for deployment.

Change-Id: I89b743fc16ea4c100ba21ddbe29081fa3e5479e9
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-17 13:07:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/a3097604c8cfbf7fbef4f191ce3ab15fdfac134b', 'message': "Remove hardcoding of overcloud deploy timeout

which is always 170 and equal to 80. It's not appropriate for all

Now overcloud deploy timeout is derived from DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT

commit_message:
Remove hardcoding of overcloud deploy timeout

Now overcloud deploy timeout is derived from DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT
which is always 170 and equal to 80. It's not appropriate for all
jobs. It will be calculated dynamically depending on how much time
remains in the job for deployment.
Pass end time of CI job to ansible playbook for calculating it.

Partial-Bug: #1738038
Change-Id: I89b743fc16ea4c100ba21ddbe29081fa3e5479e9

commit_message:
Skip symlink + vw functional tests if symlink is not enabled

Functional tests for symlink and versioned writes run and result in
falure even if symlink is not enabled.

This patch fixes the functional tests to run only if both of
symlink and versioned writes are enabled.

Change-Id: I5ffd0b6436e56a805784baf5ceb722effdf74884

commit_message:
Dev-Deploy: Setup iptables for use with docker >= 1.13.1

With Docker >= 1.13.1 the default the default FORWARD chain policy
is configured to DROP, for the l3 agent to function as expected and
VMs reach the outside world correctly this needs to be set to ACCEPT.

Change-Id: I6bea3304f5eb4ab6b37283e94e20cda7e4119a44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/62/530262/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(portdirect): With Docker >= 1.13.1 the default the default FORWARD chain # policy is configured to DROP, for the l3 agent to function as expected and # VMs reach the outside world correctly this needs to be set to ACCEPT. sudo iptables -P FORWARD ACCEPT

commit_message:
Horizon: move to kolla image with bugs fixed

Horizon has used the Kolla 4.0.0 image for some time as the 3.0.3
image pushed to dockerhub had several bugs in it. The 4.0.0 image
also has a bug where the topology view is not enabled for heat.
The 4.0.0 image is based on ocata, by moving to the `ocata` tag
we can use a image where this bug has been fixed.

Change-Id: Icca1563561454c92fcebd61f14e08f1d19289d24

commit_message:
boot: show warning if more than one match when setting --image-with

When setting --image-with meta_key=meta_value, we may got
more than one results.
We selected the first matched one silently.

This patch prints a warning message for this scenario.

Change-Id: I5be73fb61fb08d3abd0a509f3ac5cb6ea623c85a
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/87/530187/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def emit_duplicated_image_with_warning(img, image_with): img_uuid_list = [str(image.id) for image in img] print(_('WARNING: %(img_uuid_list)s match %(meta_key)s=%(meta_value)s') % {'img_uuid_list': img_uuid_list, 'meta_key': image_with[0][0], 'meta_value': image_with[0][1]}) if len(images) > 1: emit_duplicated_image_with_warning(images, args.image_with) print('First one selected: %s.' % images[0].id) if images:
deleted_lines: if images: # TODO(harlowja): log a warning that we # are selecting the first of many?

commit_message:
hardware: Flatten functions

Instead of:

    if x:
        ...lengthy bit of code

Do:

    if not x:
        (continue|return)

    ...lengthy bit of code

Improved readability FTW.

Change-Id: I0d4e00fdda7aaf9276cfa31d93bedf19127e86cd
TrivialFix

added_lines: if len(cells) != len(host_cell_perm): continue if not pci_requests: return objects.InstanceNUMATopology(cells=cells) elif ((pci_stats is not None) and pci_stats.support_requests(pci_requests, cells)): return objects.InstanceNUMATopology(cells=cells) if instancecell.id != hostcell.id: continue memory_usage = memory_usage + sign * instancecell.memory cpu_usage_diff = len(instancecell.cpuset) if (instancecell.cpu_thread_policy == fields.CPUThreadAllocationPolicy.ISOLATE and hostcell.siblings): cpu_usage_diff *= max(map(len, hostcell.siblings)) cpu_usage += sign * cpu_usage_diff if instancecell.pagesize and instancecell.pagesize > 0: newcell.mempages = _numa_pagesize_usage_from_cell( hostcell, instancecell, sign) if not instance.cpu_pinning_requested: continue pinned_cpus = set(instancecell.cpu_pinning.values()) if free: if (instancecell.cpu_thread_policy == fields.CPUThreadAllocationPolicy.ISOLATE): newcell.unpin_cpus_with_siblings(pinned_cpus) else: newcell.unpin_cpus(pinned_cpus) else: if (instancecell.cpu_thread_policy == fields.CPUThreadAllocationPolicy.ISOLATE): newcell.pin_cpus_with_siblings(pinned_cpus) else: newcell.pin_cpus(pinned_cpus) if not CONF.reserved_huge_pages: return bucket try: bucket = collections.defaultdict(dict) for cfg in CONF.reserved_huge_pages: try: pagesize = int(cfg['size']) except ValueError: pagesize = strutils.string_to_bytes( cfg['size'], return_int=True) / units.Ki bucket[int(cfg['node'])][pagesize] = int(cfg['count']) except (ValueError, TypeError, KeyError): raise exception.InvalidReservedMemoryPagesOption( conf=CONF.reserved_huge_pages)

revisions:

In disassociate_floatingips we use the _get_floatingips_by_port_id
method that is implemented by Neutron.
Its behavior has been changed and it now returns OVO FloatingIP objects
insted of the neutron FloatingIP objects.

Closes-Bug: #1738620

commit_message:
Handle changed object type in l3

In disassociate_floatingips we use the _get_floatingips_by_port_id
method that is implemented by Neutron.
Its behavior has been changed and it now returns OVO FloatingIP objects
insted of the neutron FloatingIP objects.
Add the correct handling.

Change-Id: Ib5f0a7706b2ac903859c2c9b1640398b5f38259c
Closes-Bug: #1738620
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/73/528573/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Dev-Docs: Add warning about IP ranges consumed by K8s and Calico

This PS adds a warning for the CIDRs consumed by Calico and K8s.
It should be replaced by better documentation and/or a sanity
checking chart/script when possible.

Change-Id: Ib87b773b7c19ed65330a54546c4613c16aa9ab75

commit_message:
kolla: override mysql packages for sensu

Kolla deploys Sensu with MariaDB-client but in TripleO we want to deploy
Galera package built in RDO. So like we do for mariadb_packages, we'll
override sensu_client_packages with what is needed to have mariadb
client.

Change-Id: I928fc32654216d331d04722773b300285e8148d2
(cherry picked from commit 16ac144004dd260454c77c4cfbb1660d156bd27d)

commit_message:
Fix false positive server group functional tests

Most of the evacuate tests in nova.tests.functional.test_server_group
could produce false positive results becuase of multiple reasons:
* test did not wait for the migration to finish in done or error state
  before checked the instance host
* test did not asserted that the instance host is changed during the
  evacuation

Also the evacuation tests that starts up a third compute failed to add
the magic fake.set_nodes() call making the third node unusable and
causing unexpected NoValidHost during the evacuation. However it was
not visible until the above mistakes are fixed in the test

Change-Id: Idc4e3d8ac7c99c09c6f4860dc0c7a05f28a35627
Closes-Bug: #1739013

The migration record, if found, is returned. """ for attempt in range(10): migrations = self.api.api_get('/os-migrations').body['migrations'] for migration in migrations: if (migration['instance_uuid'] == server['id'] and migration['status'].lower() == expected_status.lower()): return migration time.sleep(0.5) self.fail('Timed out waiting for migration with status "%s" for ' 'instance: %s' % (expected_status, server['id']))

commit_message:
Properly document job binary "extra"

After bp sahara-support-s3 the use of the "extra" parameter is not only
for binaries stored in Swift.

So, modify some docstrings (which are in turn included in the actual
docs) to reflect this.

Change-Id: I3683fce981a7d1812d08f3545e9a8b1d8ebb6ec1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient refs/changes/91/529691/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: """Create a Job Binary.""" * extra - dict with `user` and `password` keyword arguments

commit_message:
Drop unnecessary executable flags

This patch also adds checks for executable files in
pep8 job.

nose ignores executable files by default, so it is important
to ensure executable flag is not set for test files [1].
openstack_dashboard/test/test_plugins/panel_tests.py was not
tested actually and it was broken. This commit fixes it too.
[1] http://nose.readthedocs.io/en/latest/usage.html#cmdoption-exe

Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Change-Id: I3a124fa2f9f0676b2b43a094e32e3d8b18fa6005

Add helper cmd to generate a release schedule template

Adds a generate-schedule command that will output the yaml that
can be used for setting up a new release cycle schedule.
